title: Patch Chat with the Playtest Team - 7.19
body:
https://news-a.akamaihd.net/public/na_images/PCHCHT/Minions.jpg
Header by inkiness

Hey, everyone! I'm Riot King Cobra and it's time for another round of Patch Chat! These threads serve as opportunity for us to talk about the patches that come out every two weeks. You can find the most recent patch by following this link: [Patch 7.19 Notes](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-719-notes).

I'm on Riot's Playtest Team, a group of high elo players who play with the new champions, reworks, balance tweaks, items, and map updates before they are released. It's our job to the test the changes that our designers come up with and ensure that we're introducing positive changes to League in terms of both balance and fun.

7.19 premiers the updated Azir and Xin Zhao! We've also changed Aatrox, Caitlyn, Janna, Malphite, Orianna, Ornn, Vayne, and Veigar! We finally nerfed Ardent Censer and Bramble Vest and adjusted a few other items as well. Ask us questions about the patch, or anything else you're interested for that matter. We'd love to talk with you guys. :) 

Don “Aesah” Ding
Adam "Afic" Cohen
Dan “penguin” Hardison
Robert “ROBERTxLEE” Lee
Rob "King Cobra" Rosa
Trevor “ThEntropist” Thernes
Arnor "Hjarta" Halldorsson
Brian "Madness Heroo" Pressoir
Christy "Ender L" Frierson
Chris "Auberaun" Roberts
Nick "Endstep" Frijia
Nabi "Novalas" Barak
Sigmundur "GangIeri" Helgason

replies.body: Ekko buffs when?
Woops wrong account
{{champion:45}}

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Afic,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=f8hp6yG8,comment-id=000f0000,timestamp=2017-09-26T23:46:50.768+0000)
>
> {{champion:45}}

You made my day with that reply Afic. Thank you dude lol.
hmm, yea everyone does basically get highlander for free.  Guess we can just straight remove it from Yi's kit now :^)

For him to be a better champion I believe we would need to address some of the frustration of playing against him.  To me that means removing/weakening the invulnerability (when I see Yi doing well the most frustrating thing is the cadence at which he can gap close and go invulnerable).  Taking that away might disappoint Yi players more than it helps (assuming we would add power back somewhere else in his kit).  Regardless, Yi would probably be a very complex champion to address in a meaningful way.

Afic, since you're a Quinn afficionado (iirc):

Can you elaborate on why her Q has a scaling AD ratio? Is it to limit early snowballing?

Because the way I see it, the downside of that scaling ratio is that it forces you to max that ability ASAP, both impacting her build variety and her viability in the bot lane (because you want as much XP as possible).

In light of the preseason changes to runes (reduction of starting AD and starting Lethality), would it be plausible to flatten the ratio to the same at all ranks and adjust the base damage accordingly?

I'm not Afic, but I am also a pretty big Quinn player on the Playtest team. As far as why Quinn has a scaling AD ratio on Q, there's a variety of reasons, including the ones you mention - there's others as well, like discouraging E max and allowing her to have high potential damage lategame (especially in combination with the large W steroid), both burst and sustained. 

I'd say the main argument against having a fixed AD ratio on Q is that Quinn is already a champion that is extraordinarily strong 1v1 and very difficult to actually engage on, especially as a melee. Making the AD ratio on Q fixed is a substantial buff to E max, which would make Quinn even more miserable to lane against than she already is, since it punishes interaction so hard (she's already one of the most undesirable champions to lane against toplane, for good reason). If E max is then discouraged (e.g. by making E a fixed cooldown that doesn't scale down with ranks), then suddenly Quinn has no skill to max that is impactful in the earlygame, which likely means Quinn doesn't function as a champion.

Having a scaling ratio on the Q does limit Quinn's viability botlane since it ties her power pretty hard into levels, but I'd say it's the best solution to an unfortunate problem. Quinn's scaling AD ratio on Q is there because of her kit, not because of any rune choices or other out-of-game optimization, and I think it's very unlikely to change.

Is there any chance Quinn could get another pass at an update? I just recently gave her up after 200k mastery points not including before that system came out. Ive played her 5x more then any other champion in the game... i just had to give her up. She doesnt fit anywhere anymore.. tanks are just plain more useful, assassains have better burst and in combat mobility, other marksmen outperform her... She doesn't have a place anymore on the rift. Picking her top sacrefices a fighter with more teamfight potential, picking her jungle is mediocre at best. Mid has too many bad matchups. Other marksmen are much more useful so she cant go adc. Support is not an option due to lack of utility... 

I love Quinn to death, but she needs work. She only has two combative abilities in q and vault. Sure you can pop vision mid fight for various reasons, but I hardly count that as combative. Her ult is canceled by nondamaging slows like karthus wall and wither... dont get me started on the slow that is applied when minions hit her. Her channel is canceled by everything under the sun including minion damage... All these little things are annoying at best and are needless limitiations to the champion as she is. These couls be changed woth a simple QoL patch.

Her skill cealing was lowered with the rework, with her two mechanics remaining being vision manipulation and vault timing. Thats it. Theres nothing else. Target management is simple, without much depth.

Her thematic is butchered ever since Valor was shot and replaced by Taxi. They no longer feel like they work in tandom, all Taxi is now is a mount. She is supposed to be Quinn and Valor, but she plays as Quinn. She was two champions, but was mashed into one and had her abilities butchered.

I love and will always love Quinn, but I cant main her in her current state. Shes a shell of a champion, and she is forgotten for the second time. This is probably not the place to ask, but please, please look into something for her. This is the first time I have heard her name on the boards since the period after her rework.

There's nothing stopping us from updating Quinn but it's not something that's being looked into at the moment. From my experience talking to a few designers about Quinn I'd guess that eventually she'll probably get some kind of update but it's most definitely not a priority right now. Of the designers I've discussed Quinn with, most felt that her kit isn't in a great state, but her kit is extremely difficult to work with and she has a fair few issues to address, so the amount of work she needs to be put into an ideal state is probably quite high.

@ Penguin

> [{quoted}](name=penguin,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=gbAKMKGa,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-08-23T23:38:49.307+0000)
>
> We playtest based on changes incoming to the game; so regularly playtesting Zyra mid isn't something we'd be doing unless she was receiving balance changes.

Who will playtest Zyra mid for the rune patch to gauge the impact of losing 20-26 mpen? By my estimates, she will be losing 10-20% of her damage at all stages of the game. 

Also, plants cannot proc Comet, Aerie, or stack Electrocute.

These are the kinds of nerfs that would be tested, right?
There are investigations being made by designers that affect most AP mid casters (their damage across the board is generally lower than we'd like right now, and this isn't a Zyra-specific problem)

Please consider a few points here:

1) Mages starting with 14-20 mpen in runes + Precision, then rushing 3 mpen items are hit hardest by the rune changes. The scale of that nerf is unique to those 2-3 mages. If, for example, you buff mage damage by 10% across the board, that doesn't fix mages who lost 20% of their damage along with their power spikes.

2) It is a Zyra-specific problem because the other pen mages are tested in solo lane and balanced for solo lane. After repeat promises in the MYMU to balance her for mid, it never happened.

I would just like some sort of acknowledgment that pen mages are disproportionately affected, that this is on the radar as a discreet issue for testing, and that solo Zyra will be factored into testing/balance.

We intentionally haven't been testing zyra mid.  We tend to focus on stuff that we theorycraft to be strong, is currently a meta pick, or has no other place where they can succeed.  Zyra mid does not meet that criteria, as we don't expect her to be disproportionately powerful mid, she isn't a meta mid pick, and she works better in the bot lane.  

With that said, she should still be able to use comet or electrocute (plants won't proc it by themself, but it should count as 1 instance).  It is possible that it is bugged.  As to her losing damage from lack of MPen, all mages actually have their damage down despite everyone having base MR reduced.  It is something we are looking to address systematically first, and if Zyra (support) is an outlier we will address it then.

Forgetting something?

> [{quoted}](name=20thCenturyFaux,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=xVQr7ihf,comment-id=00180001,timestamp=2016-03-18T03:32:11.929+0000)
>
> She gets played both lanes successfully and will continue to--we're committed to keeping her strong in both lanes.


> [{quoted}](name=20thCenturyFaux,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=xVQr7ihf,comment-id=002e000300000001,timestamp=2016-03-19T02:36:56.074+0000)
>
> Our plan was to make her viable mid and balance around support, so we wouldn't be happy if she was a weak midlaner. 


> [{quoted}](name=20thCenturyFaux,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=xVQr7ihf,comment-id=00410000,timestamp=2016-03-18T04:42:55.136+0000)
>
> Yep! We want her to be viable in both roles.


> [{quoted}](name=20thCenturyFaux,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=xVQr7ihf,comment-id=002e000300000001000b0009,timestamp=2016-03-25T23:40:20.121+0000)
>
>Going forward, we’re putting her in more midlane tests and making sure we don’t leave a lane behind.

Stealth change of plans? Lies? PR doublespeak? These posts cannot coexist with what you just said or the evidence that has played out since the MYMU.

But just to clarify, if she doesn't meet your criteria for playtesting in mid, isn't that something you would tell a designer so they can address the issue? Not playtesting her just turns 20thCentury into a liar retroactively, and I do not believe that was his intent at the time.

I am referring to playtest team prioritization, not Riot design prioritization.  We have a long list of champions/matchups/builds/etc. to test that there is simply no way for us to get to all of (especially with a systemic change this big).  With that said, we need to do our best to prioritize test points to optimize our value output per game.  That means we won't be spending time on playing zyra mid because there is more consistent higher value stuff for us to test, not because we don't care about it.  She still can be played mid, we just won't be prioritizing testing it.
Is new eve forced to blink with her ult? And if yes, why is it not a double cast?
Following up, it gives her less agency to get a guaranteed kill and get out. She has to commit into a fight to get a guaranteed kill with her ultimate (and then escape).

Would it be possible to add an execute indicator, similar to Cho? Or to take it a step farther, gate the indicator by who you last used Lust Dust on? 

It would feel really bad to miscalculate your R damage by a sliver and then blink away from your target, letting them escape.

Evelynn has an indicator letting you know when the target is below 30% (for the bonus execution damage). However, it doesn't mean that they'll die by your ultimate. Not sure if we'll add in an execute indicator in the future. I agree that it would be helpful.

She is forced to blink with her ult, yes.

Will follow up soonish as to why it's not a double cast.

Eve main here and my main concern after seeing the rework is it seems her kit actively pushes her out of the jungle and into mid lane especially with lack of stealth until 6.

It also makes me think that the correct choice for eve regardless of anything else is to hit level 6 and unless a kill is guaranteed just don't bother ganking beacuse delaying your strongest part of your kit will just feel bad.

A lot of her rework adds in strength to her jungling (e.g. Q CD 60% refund on monsters, W enhanced charm + damage to monsters). Her wave clear, while passable, isn't sufficient enough to make her a lane focus imho. 

Evelynn definitely wants to hit 6 as fast as possible but she actually has dueling power pre-6 and has countergank potential with her W.

Fire now, look if the questions got answer already later.

Please share fun / fail things of Azir, Xin and Evelyn rework.

Talking on Evelynn, her ultimate blinks you back opposite of your cursor. Flash blinks you to where your cursor is. I wanted to use both to do a cool outplay disengage.

Needless to say, I ulted over the wall and then flashed back over the wall, ending up in the exact same position. Then I died. Brutally.
So far in the Aatrox rework, are there any unique changes that have been made that have not worked out? Is there anything that redefines who he is as a champion, or how he plays?
Aatrox in game is someone who never wants to see the rest of his team, but thematically led an army to victory so we've been testing some stuff more along those lines
What do you guys think about some adc's buying relic shield? And do you guys have anything planned for Bard? He kinda feels underwhelming right now.

Relic shield on ADC should be a lot less appealing now that Ardent Censer doesn't give health on hit, but I'm looking forward to see what happens

Don't think I've heard anything about Bard

Is Udyr one of the champions that had the update that stopped or is it just postponed at the moment? and would it be before Preseason? during or after? Can we just get a game breaking buff on him before the season ends lmao jk
His update was basically paused as the main designer on it was doing some work on Runes Reforged. I'm sure it will resume in time but all I can say is be patient unfortunately!

How does Janna feel with the new changes? I feel like it fits a little bit with the title of "The Storm's Fury" now, but I was wondering your thoughts when testing her. Also, how does the new Ardent feel with also giving the support the buff?

I'm of the opinion that this is a shift in playstyle, both because Ardent Censer is now weaker and Janna isn't as good as sitting behind her ADC and shielding early on, but in terms of raw power might actually be a buff that people will take some time to get used to. She has access to a _lot_ of movement speed early on, as well as stronger autoattacks and Zephyr damage that scales based off of that movement speed. If you play Janna as an aggressive harass support I think you'll find pretty significant power, you can probably even try a W max now. On the flipside because you're interacting more you're also putting yourself at greater risk to retaliation or being caught out. Later on you won't be able to do as much offensively with autoattacks and Zephyr just because the risk of being caught out is much greater, and you're still vulnerable to being blown up, but she's still pretty good at playing backline peeler after the early game. 

The Ardent Censer change is definitely a power down for the ADC buff case, and it probably shouldn't be a mandatory first item anymore. Having the buff on the support too can be useful situationally but as a support you're often trying to do other things in a teamfight besides autoattack a lot, so you have to be careful that you're not neglecting your other supportly duties and putting yourself in too much danger for some autos.
Will Riot be willing to do follow up work on Orianna if her changes to dissonance and shockwave end up causing her playstyle and reliability to dive off a cliff again?

Yes. The goal of these changes is to make her feel more reasonable to play against since before she was essentially "cheating" her W and R. If she's significantly less reliable, it's something we'll look back into.

We have various Runes that trigger from CC, but they all seem to have subtly different conditions.

* Cheap Shot works with everything, including Slows and Silenced
* Aftershock works from "immobilizing CC", so neither Slow nor Silenced
* Font of Life works from "impaired movements", so it works with Slows, but not with Silenced.
* Approach Velocity just says "CC", so I suppose it works with everything, but not on everyone: you need to be the source of the CC, or it needs to be an allied champion.

Do you have any insight on why those different rules, and wouldn't it be possible to harmonize a bit everything?

There are a variety of reasons to have different rules for different runes - the biggest one being it allows the runes to feel distinct and gives them different use cases, whereas in a world where they all have the same trigger conditions champions with those types of cc will generally just look to pick up the strongest of those runes rather than the ones that work best with their kit. 

It's also partially due to usability concerns - if Cheap Shot doesn't work on slows, then it severely restricts its usage, especially considering that it's in Domination, a tree that's mostly attractive for classes of champions without much hard cc. On the other hand, we did try a version of Aftershock in development that triggered off of slows, and we found it was actually much worse in most cases than the current version. Champions like Maokai were often triggering Aftershock unintentionally with Q and E (hilariously I once triggered it with a sapling across the map and pulled wolves on me as I walked past them), and even champions that in theory could've liked the slow trigger like Mundo didn't even want to take Aftershock when it worked on his Q. In general we just found that if Aftershock triggered off of slows, it didn't go off when you wanted it to - so restricting its timing is important.

Each rune's trigger conditions are tailored to suit both its place in the tree and how the rune itself operates.
Any info on when we'll hear about the next champ?
Soon™
Darius changes? I mean he has literally no synergy with new rune system

Darius feels pretty good on runes - it's similar to the current mastery system where he has multiple options for his keystone and can play differently depending on what is taken. Fervor, Grasp, and Stormraider's are all viable options for him now, and right now in the new system Grasp, Phase Rush, and Press the Attack are all viable options. Since those runes are all in different trees it gives Darius a lot of flexibility in how he plays the game. I'd say Darius has more synergy with the new rune system than the majority of champions.

Hey guys I wanted ask about new Eve, what are some builds, maxing orders and runes, both new and old that you guys taking on her. On a side note do you guys think its a bit harder to playtest things and gouge power levels with new runes even tho stuff ships live with the current system. And can I get the team's thoughts on that flash ult by Cobra on stream

I'll leave the first part of this up to the Eve playtester, but for the last two points:

Gauging power level on stuff shipping this patch was definitely harder - we spent a large number of playtests on runes, so we had a lower number of playtests on live runes and masteries with stuff like Eve and Janna than we normally would have.

As for the flash ult by Cobra on stream...as the Gnar that jumped in immediately afterwards and misangled my ult, it was generally just a bad time. Team thoughts were along the lines of "uhh...Cobra?"

Hey there Spideraxe, always excited to talk about #1 bae Evelynn. 


Starting off, I've found most success on burst orientated builds (e.g. Runic Echoes, Protobelt, and Lichbane). Afterwards, having a defensive item in some capacity is very useful since you tend to be right in the enemy team's faces (Abyssal Mask or Zhonya's Hourglass are good items for this). Finally, the last item is a flex pick (generally Void Staff/Liandrys/More AP?). 

Max order, imho, is Q into W into E. W max second allows you to get an extended range on W, higher MR shred, and longer charm duration. Start off Q -> W -> E.

Runes on live would be standard AP (AP Quints, MPen Marks, Armor Seals, AP Glyphs). 

For Runes Reforged, I take this.
http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/preseason-update/8100-8112?build=10200237
Do u have any good news for Volibear T_T? And one question I'm asking, why u don't have a one PBE server for Europe? I want to test things but the ping makes it difficult for us to test

Nothing new for volibear specifically, but Runes Reforged coming up will have pretty substantial impact across all of League.  

In terms of PBE, we aren't really the best people to ask, as we have super limited insight into that whole process.  Sorry I don't have a better answer for you.
Great, with Ardent no longer being this game warping Mordekaiser ADC is going to be even better!
